meanings.def: to take something from a person, shop, etc. without permission and without intending to return it or pay for it
examples: I'll report you to the police if I catch you stealing again.
steal from somebody/something We found out he'd been stealing from us for years.
steal something My wallet was stolen.
I had my wallet stolen.
Thieves stole jewellery worth over £10 000.
steal something from somebody/something He stole a car from the parking lot of a mall.
It's a crime to handle stolen goods.
He was charged with possession of stolen property.
(figurative) to steal somebody’s ideas
(figurative) They accused the president of stealing the election (= winning it by cheating).
Lock your bike up so that nobody can steal it.
The best kitchen knives are made from stainless steel.
They had to steel themselves to watch their cherished work being destroyed.

meanings.def: to move secretly and quietly so that other people do not notice you
examples: She stole out of the room so as not to wake the baby.
(figurative) A chill stole over her body.

meanings.def: to run to the next base before another player from your team hits the ball, so that you are closer to scoring
examples: He tried to steal second base but was out.

meanings.def: to look at somebody/something quickly so that nobody sees you doing it
to make somebody fall in love with you
to kiss somebody suddenly or secretly
to gain an advantage over somebody by doing something before them
examples: The company is looking at ways to steal a march on its European competitors.

meanings.def: to attract more attention and praise than other people in a particular situation
examples: As always, the children stole the show.
British bands stole the show at this year’s awards.

meanings.def: to get the attention, success, etc. that somebody else was expecting, usually by saying or doing what they had intended to say or do

idioms.def: to get the attention, success, etc. that somebody else was expecting, usually by saying or doing what they had intended to say or do

examples: The robbery from the Met was the greatest art steal in history.

meanings.def: the act of running to another base while the pitcher is throwing the ball
to be for sale at an unexpectedly low price
examples: This suit is a steal at $80.
